oai_dc:dc.dc:title: TESTING NEW COPPER COMPOUNDS AND CUPRIC ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS AGAINST DOWNY MILDEW IN ORGANIC VITICULTURE
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Viticulture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In two years, characterized by climatic conditions favourable to the development of Plasmopara viticola, cupric products at low dose and alternative compounds have been tested for the control of downy mildew in organic vineyard. Copper compounds have shown to control downy mildew in a satisfactory way; the alternative compounds were not resulted in a satisfactory control of the pathogen.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: La Torre, A.; Spera, G.; Lolletti, D. and Cargnello, G. (Eds.) (2005) TESTING NEW COPPER COMPOUNDS AND CUPRIC ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS AGAINST DOWNY MILDEW IN ORGANIC VITICULTURE. . Proceedings of GESCO XIVth Internationales Weinbau-Symposium, Geisenheim, 23-27 Agust 2005.
